trans-unit.source: Represents a group created by a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CollectionView"></xref> object based on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.GroupDescriptions*>.

When you define groups using the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.GroupDescriptions%2A>, your view object (a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource> object or an object that derives from <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView>) wraps each group in a CollectionViewGroup object.
## XAML Text Usage You cannot use this class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup"></xref> class with the name of the group.
The name of this group.
Gets a value that indicates whether this group has any subgroups.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this group is at the bottom level and does not have any subgroups; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the number of items in the subtree under this group.
Subclasses use the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup.ProtectedItemCount%2A> property to change the count.
The number of items (leaves) in the subtree under this group.
Gets the immediate items contained in this group.
Subclasses use the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup.ProtectedItems%2A> property to add or remove items.
A read-only collection of the immediate items in this group.
This is either a collection of subgroups or a collection of items if this group does not have any subgroups.
Gets the name of this group.
The name of this group which is the common value of the property used to divide items into groups.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup.PropertyChanged"></xref> event using the provided arguments.
Arguments of the event being raised.
Occurs when a property value changes.
To be added.
Gets and sets the number of items in the subtree under this group.
Subclasses use this property to change the count; the changes are reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup.ItemCount%2A> property.
The number of items (leaves) in the subtree under this group
Gets the immediate items contained in this group.
Subclasses use this property to add or remove items; the changes are reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup.Items%2A> property.
A collection of immediate items in this group.
This is either a collection of subgroups or a collection of items if this group does not have any subgroups.
